items.label: Eyebrowse
items.summary: Using eyebrowse, users gain control over how they are being tracked, by selectively allowing certain domains to be their public spaces on the web. In addition, they also get a chance to bump into and converse with people while surfing on these domains in real-time, much like they would in real-life public spaces.

items.label: Murmur
items.summary: Murmur is exploring ways to improve  traditional mailing list and discussion forums, to make them better for carrying out large substantive discussions.

items.label: Soylent
items.summary: Soylent is a crowd-powered interface: one that embeds workers from Mechanical Turk into Microsoft Word. It uses crowd contributions to perform interactive document shortening, proofreading, and human-language macros. Underlying Soylent is a new programming design pattern called Find-Fix-Verify that splits tasks into a series of generation and review stages to control costs and increase quality.

items.label: VoiceX
items.summary: VoiceX is an open source platform designed to create an information ecosystem for people in developing world, with low-end feature phones that can't connect to the Internet, to generate, manage, retrieve, and search information.

items.label: Confer
items.summary: Confer helps you build a personal schedule for conference you are attending. It helps you decide where to spend your time by providing social recommendations based on your interests, and discover new people who have similar interests as yours.

items.label: DataHub
items.summary: DataHub is a (GitHub like) hosted platform for organizing, managing, sharing, collaborating, and making sense of data. It provides an efficient platform and easy to use tools/interfaces for publishing of your own data (hosting, sharing, collaboration), using otherâ€™s data (querying, linking), and making sense of data (analysis, visualization).

items.label: Datapress
items.summary: Datapress helps WordPress users create, share, and publish data in their blogs using Exhibit. Easily link to data sources found in other blogs, files, or in Google Docs, and then use a graphical wizard to configure your visualization.

items.label: Sync Kit
items.summary: Sync Kit helps cache the uncacheable: dynamic and user-specific data. Sync Kit provides Django developers with simple synchronization primitives to use in place of their data model objects. Using a browser-side database, relational data is then cached locally in the browser and efficiently updated when a user returns to the web site. Benchmarks show up to a 400% server throughput improvement with this method.

items.label: Cascading Tree Sheets (CTS)
items.summary: Cascading Tree Sheets are a declarative transformation language for the web that simplifies web content creation and reuse.

items.label: atomate
items.summary: Atomate is a programmable web-bot that lets users automate simple tasks through the construction of context-aware reactive behaviors.  These behaviors are driven by data from Web (RSS/Atom) feeds, and are specified through a constrained natural language interface.

items.label: FeedMe
items.summary: FeedMe makes it easier to send brief e-mails to your friends to share links. Once you've started sharing, it starts recommending friends who might be interested in seeing the post you're looking at. Ideally this makes it even faster to share with more people who would find content relevant, without requiring you to type or switch windows.

items.label: Dido
items.summary: Dido is a web page that contains data and visualizations of it that you can edit right in the page. It's based on our Exhibit framework, but adds the ability to modify what you are looking at.

items.label: Exhibit
items.summary: a lightweight data publishing framework that you can use to create rich mash-ups using just HTML and JSON. No database, no web application whatsoever.

items.label: Jourknow and Information Scraps
items.summary: What if your computer could do much better than being a digital sticky note application? What if it could remember where you were, or what you meant, and possibly even help you get it done?

items.label: PLUM
items.summary: a research platform for investigating how we can make computers more personal while at the same time preserving people's privacy and keeping control within the hands of users.

items.label: NB
items.summary: a tool for students to ask questions and discuss answers about lecture notes by annotating them.

items.label: list.it
items.summary: list.it, the Latitudinal Information Scrap Trapper that Indexes Things - is a small, simple note-keeping tool for solving a big, complex task -- helping you manage the tons of little information bits you need to keep track of each day. list.it does this by focusing on speed and simplicity. We have gotten rid of everything except a way to get things in and out quickly, so that you can get things out of your head and somewhere you can access easily any time.
